contentrichtext.text: '''Queen Anne's Bounty''' was a fund established in 1704 to augment the incomes of the poorer clergy of the [[Church of England]]. The bounty was funded by the tax (''[[annates]]'') on the incomes of all Church of England clergy, which was paid to the Pope until the [[Protestant Reformation|Reformation]], and thereafter to the Crown. In 1890, the total amount distributed was [[Pound sterling|Â£]]176,896. On 2 April 1947, by the Church Commissioners Measure 1947, the functions and assets of Queen Anne's Bounty were merged with the [[Ecclesiastical Commissioners]] to form the [[Church Commissioners]].<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | authorlink = | coauthors = | year = | url = http://www.churchofengland.org/about-us/structure/churchcommissioners.aspx | title = The Church Commissioners | format = | work = The Church Commissioners Measure 1947 | publisher = | accessdate = April 19, 2006 }}</ref> ==Legislation== * The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1703]] (2 & 3 Anne c 20) '''The Queen Anne's Bounty Acts 1706 to 1870''' is the [[collective title]] of the following Acts:<ref>The [[Short Titles Act 1896]], section 2(1) and Schedule 2</ref> *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1706]] (6 Anne c 24) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1707]] (6 Anne c 54) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1714]] (1 Geo 1 stat 2 c 10) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1716]] (3 Geo 1 c 10) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1803]] (43 Geo 3 c 107) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1805]] (45 Geo 3 c 84) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1838]] (1 & 2 Vict c 20) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty Act 1840]] (3 & 4 Vict c 20) *The [[Queen Anne's Bounty (Superannuation) Act 1870]] (33 & 34 Vict c 89) ==See also== * [[Board of First Fruits]] * [[John Ecton]] (d. 1730) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.cofe.anglican.org/about/churchcommissioners/ccorigins/qabbooklet.pdf Queen Anne's Bounty Tercentenary Commemorative Booklet] * [http://archives.lambethpalacelibrary.org.uk/calmview/Record.aspx?src=CalmView.Catalog&id=qab The archives of the Governors of the Bounty of Queen Anne are held at the Church of England Record Centre] {{Nuttall|title=Queen Anne's Bounty}} [[Category:1704 establishments in England]] [[Category:1947 disestablishments]] [[Category:History of the United Kingdom]] {{Anglican-stub}}
